featured.text: Moran came to the United States at age 7 with his family and settled in Philadelphia.
In 1871 Moran joined the first US government survey of the Yellowstone region with photographer William Henry Jackson.
It was the only national park established because of Moran’s works.
Moran began painting by age 15, inspired by the landscape paintings of the British master J.M.W. Turner.

other.text: Before Moran arrived, Yellowstone in the popular imagination was a harsh, wild place with hot water and steam coming out of hellish holes in the ground.
Why does the author use “the blackened heart” in paragraph 2 to describe Moran’s hometown?
Moran’s watercolors—the first color renderings of the area—as well as Jackson’s photos and the survey results were presented to the Congress.
Showing great talent in painting, Moran was soon hired as an illustrator at Scribner’s Monthly, and later appointed chief illustrator by age 34.
Captivated by the utterly fantastic sights Langford described, Moran became eager to see this odd territory for himself.
That was all the nature that Moran knew.
By the time Moran died, he had painted a dozen other areas that would become national parks or monuments.

definition.zh_def: 一種用於形容愚蠢或無知的人的貶義詞。
definition.en_def: A derogatory term used to describe a person who is perceived as foolish or ignorant.
definition.example: He acted like a moran when he ignored all the warnings.
